poem:
### Market Movements

A shift in the ether—  
lines on a graph  
arc like sparrows  
above asphalt streets.  

Europe stirs,  
pigeons coo  
in financial squares;  
echoes of Asia's rally  

beneath a placid sky.  
Trump whispers,  
and in the hush,  
a thousand shares race,  

senseless, toward  
the light.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "European markets set to soar after Trump’s tariff U-turn sparks rally in Asia – business live 8.03am BST The London stock market is opening slowly as market makers try to match buy and sell orders…. The FTSE 100 index has gained over 1%, but around half the stocks on the index haven’t actually traded yet…. Updated at 8.03am BST 8.01am BST France’s top central banker has warned that US President Donald Trump’s policies in recent". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
